segment.source: 5031(F) The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.
segment.target: 5031(F) The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 5031(F) The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.
segment.target: Describes security event 5031(F) The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.

segment.source: 5031(F): The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.
segment.target: 5031(F): The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates when an application was blocked from accepting incoming connections on the network by Windows Filtering Platform.
segment.target: This event generates when an application was blocked from accepting incoming connections on the network by Windows Filtering Platform.

segment.source: If you don’t have any firewall rules (Allow or Deny) in Windows Firewall for specific applications, you will get this event from Windows Filtering Platform layer, because by default this layer is denying any incoming connections.
segment.target: If you don’t have any firewall rules (Allow or Deny) in Windows Firewall for specific applications, you will get this event from Windows Filtering Platform layer, because by default this layer is denying any incoming connections.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: None.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: None.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Profiles Type = UnicodeString: network profile using which application was blocked.
segment.target: Profiles Type = UnicodeString: network profile using which application was blocked.

segment.source: Possible values:
segment.target: Possible values:

segment.source: Domain
segment.target: Domain

segment.source: Public
segment.target: Public

segment.source: Private
segment.target: Private

segment.source: Application Type = UnicodeString: full path and file name of executable file for blocked application.
segment.target: Application Type = UnicodeString: full path and file name of executable file for blocked application.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 5031(F): The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.
segment.target: For 5031(F): The Windows Firewall Service blocked an application from accepting incoming connections on the network.

segment.source: You can use this event to detect applications for which no Windows Firewall rules were created.
segment.target: You can use this event to detect applications for which no Windows Firewall rules were created.

segment.source: If you have a pre-defined application which should be used to perform the operation that was reported by this event, monitor events with “Application” not equal to your defined application.
segment.target: If you have a pre-defined application which should be used to perform the operation that was reported by this event, monitor events with “Application” not equal to your defined application.

segment.source: You can monitor to see if “Application” is not in a standard folder (for example, not in System32 or Program Files) or is in a restricted folder (for example, Temporary Internet Files).
segment.target: You can monitor to see if “Application” is not in a standard folder (for example, not in System32 or Program Files) or is in a restricted folder (for example, Temporary Internet Files).

segment.source: If you have a pre-defined list of restricted substrings or words in application names (for example, “mimikatz” or “cain.exe”), check for these substrings in “Application.”
segment.target: If you have a pre-defined list of restricted substrings or words in application names (for example, “mimikatz” or “cain.exe”), check for these substrings in “Application.”
